lead_paragraph: The government-subsidized plans for older Americans were forecast to wither in the face of cuts under the Affordable Care Act. Instead, they have thrived.

headline.print_headline: Medicare Sign-Up Surge Confounds Expectations That Plans Would Falter
headline.main: Surge in Medicare Advantage Sign-Ups Confounds Expectations

snippet: The government-subsidized plans for older Americans were forecast to wither in the face of cuts under the Affordable Care Act. Instead, they have thrived.
abstract: Number of Americans enrolled in private insurance plans through Medicare has reached over 17 million, large increase since passage of Affordable Care Act in 2010, when number was under 11 million; large increase defies predictions made by experts that law would lead to sharp drop in enrollment in such plans.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
